snippet: Brian Goldner, the toymaker’s president and chief executive, credited the strength of the company’s Transformers and My Little Pony franchise with helping to drive sales.
abstract: Hasbro cites brisk sales of Transformers figures and My Little Pony toys for its fourth-quarter profit of $154.9 million, or $1.12 a share, from $148.8 million in year-ago quarter; revenue rose 1 percent to $1.3 billion, and 5 percent to $4.28 billion for 2014.
lead_paragraph: Brian Goldner, the toymaker’s president and chief executive, credited the strength of the company’s Transformers and My Little Pony franchise with helping to drive sales.

headline.main: My Little Pony and Transformers Toys Help Lift Hasbro Sales, and Its Profit Jumps
headline.print_headline: My Little Pony and Transformers Toys Help Lift Hasbro Sales, and Its Profit Jumps
